items.title: Codecademy Data Scientist: Machine Learning Specialist Certificate
details: Query and manipulate data with SQL and Python pandas.
Create data visualizations with Python matplotlib and seaborn.
Summarize and analyze datasets, conduct hypothesis testing.
Build, train, and test supervised and unsupervised machine learning models.
Evaluate model performance and decide when to apply a given model.

items.title: Software Engineer
details: Designed and Developed over three features for an application to increase F&I profits for dealerships using react,storybook, and web services.
Engineered a feature for Avail Car Sharing to improve the efficiency of authentication flow while assuring thedata is stored and updated for the user base.

Built a module to update and view available products for users and improved the authentication flow for login ofall users using test-driven development with Junit, react, spring boot, and JSON Restful API.

items.title: Networking and Operations Intern
details: Analyzed IT customers’ challenges and implemented solutions that both pleased the customers and aligned withdepartment standards, policies, and procedures.
Troubleshoot and resolved timely reported issues with a focus on customer service and service level objections.

organizations: Founder & Conference Coordinator, Connect at Creighton Conference, Omaha, NE, May 2019 to February 2020

Coordinated the first-ever conference on Creighton's campus that was geared towards promoting career growth opportunities for underrepresented racial minorities to connect underrepresented minorities with Creighton Alumni, Industry professionals.
Designed a student-led conference that partners with the Creighton University Office of Institutional Diversity & Inclusion, Creighton Career Center, and University Relations.
Diversity & Inclusion Coordinator, Creighton Student Union (Student Government), Omaha, NE, January 2019 to August 2020
Implemented a cultural competency course to educate students about the importance of learning and accepting other people and their cultures.
Currently working on a first-ever pilot program at my school to provide free feminine products.
Advisory Council Member, NSCS National Leadership Council, Washington D.C., January 2017 to August 2019
The National Leadership Council (NLC) is a student advisory board is comprised of selected NSCS members who advise the NSCS Board of Directors and national staff.
The NLC collects feedback from chapters to improve the NSCS experience for all members, and NLC members speak at their chapter’s New Member Induction Ceremony held in the fall.
NLC members serve as peer resources to chapter officers and NSCS’ member engagement team.
Volunteer, Minnie’s Food Pantry, Dallas, TX, November 2021 to December 2021
Distributed over 17,000 meals to our hungry friends during Thanksgiving and Christmas giveaways
Children’s Ministry Volunteer, CityLight Church Omaha, Omaha, NE, September 2019 to March 2020
Implemented a weekly curriculum for the spiritual development of an average of 40 kids from birth to one yearOld.
Maintained communication with the parents to ensure child development was progressing in a positive direction.

items.title: Radlab Intern
